result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashton B. McCoy

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 10:45 AM: Defendant Ashton B. McCoy in court. Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Ashton B. McCoy. Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Plea colloquy entertained. Collateral consequences explained. Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of PPDA. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and stays JOC. Court accepts terms and conditions of PPDA. Matter stayed for 2 years. Defendant to make monthly restitution payments in the amount of $225 during the pendency of the PPDA until paid in full. The Court reminds the defendant that bond remains in effect throughout the pendency of the PPDA.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Ashton B. McCoy. Atty Rae requesting a plea hearing.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Plea hearing on September 28, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Order for Reassignment of Cases from Judge Dutcher to Judge Blader signed by Chief Judge Dutcher on 8/1/2022 filed in 2022GF27.

Case called @ 1:42 PM Defendant Ashton B. McCoy in court.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Ashton B. McCoy. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  The Court entertains wavier of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG plea entered. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on August 9, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any currency larger than $20. Defendant is not to act in a fiduciary capacity.

Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. DE is eligible for SPD services. Bond argument by DA Leusink. Bond argument by Atty Rae. Court orders: $2500 signature bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
